story:
The Enchanted Realm of Rene Magritte

Inspired by the work of surrealist painter, Rene Magritte, The Enchanted Realm of Rene Magritte will feature performance and installation set in an 8 room mansion on Governors Island.  Eight playwrights have come together to create a beautifully surreal story of love and memory; one that will weave audiences in and out of these spectacular rooms.  Magritte’s three panel mural The Enchanted Realm serves as our source material.  Exquisite Corpse Company invites you to be a part of helping us make this unforgettable experience a (sur)reality!  

Written by T. Adamson, Blake Bishton, Simon de Carvalho, Eric Marlin, Matthew Minnicino, Ran Xia, Emily Zemba, & Laura Zlatos

Directed by Tess Howsam

Featuring:

Lee Collins, Anya Krawchek, Blaire O'Leary, Max Schloner, & Danny Wilfred!


When?

                                             August 6th - September 25th

                                  Saturdays & Sundays at 2PM  & 4PM


Our Story

Founded in 2012, Exquisite Corpse Company is a performance based integrated arts company located in Brooklyn, New York. The company aims to support collaboration between emerging artists of varying mediums; and to create equal opportunities, on and off stage, for women in the arts. ECC cultivates immersive theatrical projects, challenging audiences to experience theatre and the arts through a unique lens. More information about both producorial and developmental programming is available at www.exquisitecorpsecompany.com.

Praise for ECC 

"Exquisite Corpse Company is committed to ambitious multidisciplinary performance, and this latest production of short form plays - impressively helmed by Tess Howsam – is well worth the quick ferry across the bay...Who gets painted and who gets to paint?" 

- Sarah Matusek, New York Theatre Review

"Exquisite Corpse Company has succeeded in the fact that when you leave, you yearn to learn more about the Vienna Secession. And that’s a sign of success." 

- Michael Block, Theatre in the Now

Why We Need Your Help!

As we assemble our team of artists and collaborators, we need YOU!

Thanks to you, ECC is in her fourth season!  Without you we could never have made it this far.  In order to make The Enchanted Realm of Rene Magritte a reality, we need to raise $10,000.00

What Your Funding Supports

  • To CREATE our immersive world inside 8 rooms including staircases and halls we need raw materials, art, and artists! To reach our dreams we are asking $6,500 to support this work and those making it work. An additional $200 will go toward our first ECC owned ladder and shop vacuum!Ooh La La! 
  • To bring LIFE to our world we need actors and a director/staff! To do we are asking this very small stipend we need to raise $1,700.00
  • To COSTUME our fantastic actors and to stitch this surreal world together we need a small budget of $900.00
  • To PROMOTE all of these artistic energies we will need a humble budget of $500.00
  • To REHEARSE we ask for only $200 to supplement our time outside of our house on Gov. Island! 
  • Not to mention: Everything you donate is tax deductible!!

That's GREAT news for your taxes, but it also means that we have an external organization providing intense oversight of how every dollar is spent. In other words, you can be sure that every dollar you donate will be put to good use for the company and this production.

How You Can Help

  • DONATE! whatever you can! Every little bit helps, and we can't do this without YOU! We will build this project from your generosity, and are extraordinarily grateful for any contribution you can make. As thanks for your donation, you'll get one of these super awesome gifts (shown on the right) from our creative team.
  • CHECK IT OUT! Come see The Enchanted Realm of Rene Magritte on the beautiful Governors Island, and spread the word!
  • SPREAD THE WORD! Share this campaign with your family and friends on Facebook, Twitter or wherever else you make yourself known. We are so grateful for any and all help we can get, so thank you in advance for your generous support!

~To You~

We are supremely confident in the merits of this project, and we've put together an incredible team of collaborators-- writers, actors, designers and crew. We know this is an ambitious undertaking, but we are energized by the challenges, and excited to share this brilliant project with YOU!

Love & Thanks from the Core Corpses,

Tess Howsam, Blaire O'Leary, Lee Collins, Emma Walton, Blake Bishton, Tara Elliot, and Sara Gosses.

 ...and all of the cast, writers, and artists of The Enchanted Realm of Rene Magritte.  Xx!

More About ECC

ECC has entered its fourth year of production.  The company premiered with 'Below', an original play written by Artistic Director, Tess Howsam, at the NYC International Fringe Festival and the Encore Series at the SoHo Playhouse.  In the years following, the company mounted 3 immersive collaborative projects; ODD.A.SEE, an ambitious retelling of Homer's classic in a 4,500 sq foot space, involving over 30 artists; WareART:SubTerra, a three week multi-media performance event and play series produced in collaboration with HERE Arts Center; and most recently, Secession 2015, a living gallery built in House 17 on Gov. Island to explore the stories behind the paintings, muses, and artists of the Vienna Secession.  ECC completed its first tour with Secession 2015, in November of that year, to New Orleans, LA.

ECC is dedicated to creating a community of young artists in New York who inspire and create together, and who forward the ECC mission mission of making theatre approachable and newly relevant to people of all ages.

www.ExquisiteCorpseCompany.com 

Exquisite Corpse Company is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Exquisite Corpse Company must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

Not to mention: Everything you donate is tax deductible!!
That's GREAT news for your taxes, but it also means that we have an external organization providing intense oversight of how every dollar is spent. In other words, you can be sure that every dollar you donate will be put to good use for the company and this production.How You Can Help
DONATE! whatever you can! Every little bit helps, and we can't do this without YOU! We will build this project from your generosity, and are extraordinarily grateful for any contribution you can make. As thanks for your donation, you'll get one of these super awesome gifts (shown on the right) from our creative team.

CHECK IT OUT! Come see The Enchanted Realm of Rene Magritte on the beautiful Governors Island, and spread the word!

SPREAD THE WORD! Share this campaign with your family and friends on Facebook, Twitter or wherever else you make yourself known. We are so grateful for any and all help we can get, so thank you in advance for your generous support!

~To You~We are supremely confident in the merits of this project, and we've put together an incredible team of collaborators-- writers, actors, designers and crew. We know this is an ambitious undertaking, but we are energized by the challenges, and excited to share this brilliant project with YOU!Love & Thanks from the Core Corpses,Tess Howsam, Blaire O'Leary, Lee Collins, Emma Walton, Blake Bishton, Tara Elliot, and Sara Gosses. ...and all of the cast, writers, and artists of The Enchanted Realm of Rene Magritte.  Xx!

More About ECC


ECC has entered its fourth year of production.  The company premiered with 'Below', an original play written by Artistic Director, Tess Howsam, at the NYC International Fringe Festival and the Encore Series at the SoHo Playhouse.  In the years following, the company mounted 3 immersive collaborative projects; ODD.A.SEE, an ambitious retelling of Homer's classic in a 4,500 sq foot space, involving over 30 artists; WareART:SubTerra, a three week multi-media performance event and play series produced in collaboration with HERE Arts Center; and most recently, Secession 2015, a living gallery built in House 17 on Gov. Island to explore the stories behind the paintings, muses, and artists of the Vienna Secession.  ECC completed its first tour with Secession 2015, in November of that year, to New Orleans, LA.
ECC is dedicated to creating a community of young artists in New York who inspire and create together, and who forward the ECC mission mission of making theatre approachable and newly relevant to people of all ages.
www.ExquisiteCorpseCompany.com 
Exquisite Corpse Company is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Exquisite Corpse Company must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
Short Summary

Coldwater is the debut project of Blue Cube. It will premiere in Los Angeles at the Son Of Semele Ensemble Company Creation Festival on January 15, 2014.

Paul is an academic-turned-taxi driver, trying to reconnect with society through the relationships that cycle in and out of his cab. Anne is an Ob/Gyn still haunted by her transcendental experiences in Afghanistan. Damon is a green beret confronted with a crack in his reality. The three trajectories intertwine and merge as they drive towards Coldwater Canyon. This thought-provoking play teases out the surreal in our lives, while delivering a macabre, mordant, and mystifying story.

WHO WE ARE

Blue Cube is an international collective of artist based in LA. Our goal is to create theatrical work, which challenge conventional narratives and push the boundaries of the media.

Alex Greer – ACTOR

Noelle Kenney – ACTOR

Damon Dunay - ACTOR

Mar Gómez Glez - PLAYWRIGHT / DIRECTOR

Amparo Edo Biol – COMPOSER

Tomás Peire Serrate – COMPOSER

Álvaro Martin Blanco - LIGHT DESIGNER

Nina Caussa – SET DESIGNER

Carlotta Schiavon – PRODUCER


What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to bring our play to life! We’re calling in favors, working for free, and keeping all of our costs as minimal as possible, but even with that, we need some financing to bring this story to the stage. We’re mostly looking for funds to help with wardrobe, props, art, and lighting expenses; the rest of the money we raise will go towards marketing. 

Son of Semele and Company Creation Festival

Son of Semele Ensemble (SOSE) is a Los Angeles-based ensemble theatre company. It operates their own 36-seat flexible black-box space and use it to not only produce their own work, but to co-produce the work of other progressive theatre artists and companies that they want to foster and help to grow. These co-productions are presented through two programs soseHOST and Company Creation Festival Within the Los Angeles theatre community, SOSE is considered a leader, an innovator and a unique and vital voice.

http://www.sonofsemele.org/2013/ccf_about.html
